name: W Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great, new modern hotel. Maybe one of the best W Hotels in the world. Two things go along with this -- attitude and price. But both of those are outweighed by the cool rooms and great views. As a SPG Plat, was upgraded to a cool corner suite. Just breathtaking...One other negative, they are a bit removed from city center and getting a taxi can be difficult -- and it is very far to walk.
reviews.title: Amazing Views. Very cool. Pricey. --Far from town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We changed hotels from Le Meridien to the W for the W beds, which are wonderful. We stayed in the Wow Suite, which had a beautiful view of the ocean from the bedroom and lounge area. As mentioned in other reviews, the bathroom area is separated only by a curtain you can pull shut. However, there are frosted glass partitions, which afford some privacy, which I found acceptable. There is a rain head shower, which I loved. The bathtub, however, is literally in the middle of the bedroom with a huge mirror next to it. I found this a little odd and creepy.
reviews.title: Great for a good night sleep, but aggressive staff

reviews.text: The lounge area is very swanky...live DJ and bar filled with hip hotel guests. Service was good and the staff was polite (a rarity in Barcelona).
reviews.title: Worldwide wow - definately at w barca!

reviews.text: When checking in, beware of the super aggressive hotel staff. We brought one small bag and were asked no less than 7 times if we needed help with out bag within a 5 minute span of time.b the staff does seem a bit pretentious and secret service agents, running around the hotel on missions.
reviews.title: Toilet Privacy Please

reviews.text: Ok, now for the part that was unpleasant. As we were waiting for our breakfast to arrive in our room, a man knocked on our door and insisted on coming in and checking the bar and our bedroom. As I was not dressed, we asked that he return later. He waited in the hall until our food arrived and then pushed his way into our room with clip board in hand. I was in the bedroom area getting ready, as my husband was getting the food. All of the sudden this strange staff member bursts into the bedroom area. When I asked him to leave he just continued inventorying our room, with clip board in hand. My husband came in and told the man to leave. He tried to open the closets n the hall to continue the inventory. By now even the woman who delivered our food was telling him to leave. Finally, he left. We were going to stay another night, but after that, we declined. It was a very unpleasant experience and a bit scary.
reviews.title: No other Barcelona hotel can compare to the W

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is first time when a hotel itself completely changed our plans for a trip. Instead of planned sightseeing and knowing the city better we were so impressed by the property that we switched to a relaxing resort stay. Having a fabulous beach and city view from our bed we did have a whole BCN just in front of us anyway. It was so much said here about the room but nothing compares to experience it for yourself. What a difference to other luxury accommodations we had a chance to see. Stylish, comfortable, unique. From the other hotels features the most impressive was a pool area with its magnificent views to the beach, sea, palm trees. Pool area is so relaxing with perfect service (good looking too btw) with very well priced drinks, meals. You can easily spend a days there forgetting about time. At least we did. Morning and evening walks on Barceloneta beach just in front were a relaxing treat too. And the night city view magic.
reviews.title: For us it is destination in itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the next trip we will propably have a hard task to decide, if we want to go to visit BCN or to experience W BCN again...
reviews.title: trendy and über-Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three weeks in Europe and this was by far our favorite hotel. A bit pricey but incredibly plush, modern and the views are amazing. The pool is awesome (as was the sangria) and the staff is probably the most friendly and happy staff of any place we stayed. Our room was huge and very cool. The restaurant was good too. The business center allows free printing and quick/easy access to the internet.
reviews.title: Phantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were several non-customers of the hotel trying to get to the pool area but the staff was doing a good job of keeping them out so those poolside were actual guests and, in light of the price of the hotel, acted accordingly. No drunken crazy people doing cannonballs.
reviews.title: Spectacular hotel, brilliant location, love to return one day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 20-24 May 2011 in a Cool Corner suite room #1908
reviews.title: A great improvement from previous stay!

reviews.text: About one year has passed since my first stay at this hotel. The revisit was a very pleasant surprise! My conclusion is the management has listened to the comments from their guests and the hotel had improved in all aspects beyond my expectations. The staff seems satisfied with their work and therefore service is not only quicker and smoother but also much friendlier! The suite was a heaven and spotless. Daily cleaning was impeccable. Bathroom amenities replenished regularly. Quick service at the pool area. Staff plus supervisors circulating and are being attentive all the time. Check-in/check-out procedures improved. Eclipse bar on the top floor is a very popular place (serving excellent cocktails) and will get crowded early. A special thanks to Valentina and Isabell who made our stay extra pleasant with their outstanding personal attention and assistance. In future I hope the management will make wifi free in the entire hotel (still only free in the “Living room”/lobby area) and offer free drinking water by the pool. Last year the hotel had a slack sail in the wind but this year La Vela is sailing on a run!
reviews.title: Wow - Just a wonderful hotel, right on the beach with simply brillant staff from the first welcome to the shuttle driver

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel, one of the best SPG hotels in Europe. We had a long weekend with two teenagers and the mix of city and beach was just wonderful. I can recommend this hotel and the resort.

reviews.text: Just like the image of other W hotels worldwide, this one did not disappoint. Stayed for six nights and we throughly enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel, incredible location and wonderful service

reviews.text: Guest room
reviews.title: Best choice I could have made.

reviews.text: I was on a business event in this hotel. The welcoming experience was not good when entering the hotel. The male receptionists had no information about our event and or booking (n.b.: over 90 ppl arriving there!) and their behavior was very arrogant and aggerssive. I had to go to the same level of bad behavior with them to get the booking mess up resovled and keys to my room. I must say my blood pressure still goes up thinking about it. Unbeliveable! I can well understand misstakes to happen, but bad behavior on the top of it is intolerable.

reviews.text: The elevator to the room, the corridor to the room, all public areas were playing some instrumental music. You could not escape from it. The sound environment was unpleasant. Not a grand hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed ther 3 nights and the overall impression was visually beatuiful hotel with horrifice noice of instrumental music everywhere and rude service. Would no pay this from my own pocket. Not a grand hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed here one night pre-cruise, so this is not a comprehensive review. However, we think that the location is exceptional, right on the beach but with easy access to the city. Google Maps and, even the hotel's web site, don't do justice to its fabulous location. We had a room initially in the lower 'extension', but because of the music from a private pool party on the Sunday evening, the hotel upgraded us without any hesitation to another room - a 'Wonderful' Room - in the main building and on the opposite side to the pool. Both rooms seemed the same to me - 'upgrade' seems to be a euphemism for 'swap'! That was our only issue, and that was dealt with very professionally. Lunch in the downstairs restaurant was exceptional, high quality ingredients prepared by a Spanish chef with flair - heading for the Michelin star! Breakfast was slightly disappointing for the price - nothing hot, unless ordered and at an extra charge per item. Overall, the minor points were greatly outweighed by the fabulous location.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Wonderful Location on Beach

reviews.text: Fantastic view over Barcelona, rooms are great, service not really at the level of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from this hotel are amazing. It's location a bit remote. However got a great pool area and soon also a beach area. General design trendy and modern. Room was good size and well equipped. Front wall of the room huge floor-ceiling windows with breathtaking views. However, hotel is only few months old and has already a lot of visible wear and tear. Strange. For instance, cracks on the doors, large stains on sofa, marks on painted areas in the window and on the walls. The water from the shower flows out into the room (carpet) and into the WC. At the bottom of the washbasin mirror visible damp patches already appearing. The shower room and toilette has a heavy moldy odor. The windows were not cleaned showing visible fingerprints and hand marks. Cheap trick leaving first bottle of water by the bed with a complimentary sign and then putting new ones with identical sign but with a charge! A heavy cost for internet (when are hotels going to stop with this ridiculous thing!). General service very poor. Our room wasn’t cleaned on 2 occasions. Amenities weren’t replenished. Broken cocktail glass not replaced. Service in pool area a joke! 45 minutes wait for a drink! With only 40 other people at the pool area! 35 minutes for a ham and cheese toast! How will it be when hotel is heavily occupied? On upper pool area guest were told to order in the downstairs bar since no staff working this area. It’s unorganized and inefficient. Wooden deck around the pool seems to be poor quality and already bending and cracking. One person got a foot injured walking on the deck. No complimentary water around the pool. Although free wifi the signal is extremely poor. The views from the top bar Eclipse again amazing but only to notice already at eight in the evening almost all tables being reserved. So, you want a pre-dinner cocktail and watch the views, make sure to book a table well in advance! Crazy! Check-in and check-out procedures are slow. Some days could see endless lines of people waiting to either check-in or out. Spa is fantastic with a very service minded staff. The gym is huge with top of the line equipment. I hope the management will do something about the service and maintenance otherwise they will end up with many unhappy guests. I would love to return but at the moment they are unable to compete with other hotels like Arts or Mandarin O.
reviews.title: Very, very cool place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews I decided to stay at the hotel due to the fact that it was very modern and close to the UK. I won’t lie I don’t like Barcelona but it’s a warm temperature and when at the hotel you feel you can be at any country in the world, away from the hustle and bustle. I am a platinum member so when I arrived at 11am to be told I could not check in I was not happy. I eventually checked in at 4pm so was very unhappy at this stage. After being shown my room eventually it was rather grubby and dirty so had to move twice more until satisfied. The room was modern and a great view. The pool and the beach area reserved just for guests was also a very high standard. To be honest it did not fit in with Barcelona which was a bit of a dump I did not really like to leave the hotel. The problem in the evening was the loud vibrating music coming from the pool and from the club above so could not sleep as was very loud and went on until 3am. I also disliked a little people coming to use the bars and clubs that could never afford to stay at the hotel at €600 Euros a night and trying to be pretentious.
reviews.title: Very modern hotel but customer service could be better ..

reviews.text: I would go back as its convenient for a quick break in the sun in a modern hotel but would not say I love it.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you know what you are getting

reviews.text: I left with mixed feelings...
reviews.title: Amazing
Great Experience
reviews.text: This actually is a VERY good hotel, but it's really important to know some specifics about it. First, the location is gorgeous, right on the sea and every room has a WOW view. However, the drawback is that with that location, you are at least a 25 minute walk to the city center and La Ramblas. The room was outstanding and very high tech, and of course that view! The service wasn't as good as some other places, but I believe that's just because this hotel is so large. The lobby and public spaces are very "W", which means they are dark and have very strange lighting. My old eyes sometimes had a hard time on the stairs. The dining room is nice but extremely pricey. They have a nightclub on the 26th floor which has great views, but they made us feel unwanted (maybe we were too old? Mid-50s?)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for its fabulous rooms and views, but if you want individualized service, made to feel welcome, and/or want a short walk to town, you probably want a different hotel.

reviews.text: My brother and I had a week stay at the W Barcelona. It must of had been opened for 7 months by the time we checked in.

reviews.text: First I have to say that it is one beautiful hotel. The rooms are fully decked out in electronic lights, curtains, etc. the view from the room was fantastic. But what really failed it for me was the hotel services. It took us more then 3 hrs to check into the room as the room wasn't ready by 2pm and the front desk was heavily backed up. We did receive a lovely lunch in compensation. We also got told that check in was suppose to be at 4pm which we didn't appreciate (who checks there guests in at 4pm)??
reviews.title: Mind blowing views and stylish design

reviews.text: W Barcelona offers a stunning combination of the most elaborate design and one of a kind views of the city center. The rooms feature exceptional views right from your hotel bed. They boast sleek design and elegant furnishing.
reviews.title: Wonderful if not WOW

reviews.text: Stayed at the W with my family at the end of our cruise for two days to unwind before heading back. The check in process/ desks were crowded lacked coordination. Checked in early and left the bags with the bellman to return at 3 for the normal check in time. Rooms were not ready and they had no idea when they would be ready. I complained it was no way to treat a Gold member customer, still the staff was clueless. Finally got to my room but there was mold in the shower stall and the bathroom mirror has started to peel at the bottom. The view from the room was nice, but you can't live in a view. The wait staff at the pool was
reviews.title: Overpriced, overcrowded and over there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: friendly, but the prices for food and drink were high even for a W. great and prompt room service and the waiters were fine at the Wave restaurant but the food was just so so.
reviews.title: If you can do it...do it!

reviews.text: As soon as we walked into the spacious lobby, we were instantly captured by the turned-up electronica being played by what sounded like a live dj. The host team was decked in tailored grey suits and dresses for women. Not a long line for check in and was greeted with a smile and also given a peronal biz card by our host who requested us to call him directly with any issues. Our room was ready upon arrival and we were truly "wow'd" by the room. It was a very large deluxe room with a king bed in the center of the room which faced the floor-to-ceiling windows facing the Mediterranean Sea. There are Man Buttons on the side of the bed too! I call them man buttons because it's the perfect remote control but it operates the lights throughout the whole room...even the lights under the bed! Our only real issue was that the shower (which had a rainfall shower head) clogged easily by the foam from our shower gels (I used the one they provided) so the water went all over the place including the carpet. Our highlight was hanging out by the pool at night (pool bar closed at midnight on Monday) which is completed by Miami-esque lighting , cool lounge areas and great music! It's where we are staying next time for sure!
reviews.title: Beautiful views and a distinct vibe

reviews.text: Striking design and rooms with view of the sea, this hotel projects a hip vibe that I found both fun and a bit ridiculous at the same time. Constant "cool" music in the lobby and mod lighting effects grew a bit tiresome for me, but the large standard rooms with floor to ceiling windows and sleek decor hit the mark. Free wi-fi and iPod docks are a plus, the location either a plus for quiet out-of-the-way or rather inconvenient for the traditional Barcelona sights. Nice pool and beach access.
reviews.title: This is the life!

reviews.text: The W was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. There was absolutely nothing missing- the beach was right there, La Rambla was 5 minutes away by taxi and the overall look, feel and service in the hotel was fantastic. Absolutely 7 star, I would stay nowhere else in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Perfect - a real dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, it's huge so there's always a lot going on. The hotel is decorated with quality materials, unlike so many smaller 'boutique hotels'. We had a spectacular room with beautiful view on the city, beach and sea. The room was surprisingly decorated which we liked very much. Bed in the middle of the room, comfortable lounge sofa in front of the room, excellent shower. I would have preferred a separate bath room, but this worked very well. Would defintely go back to this hotel, the staff was extremely helpfull and friendly. Prices of food and drinks are expensive but reasonable (unlike many Westin experiences we've had). The gym is the best!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, perfectly located at the beach, very friendly staff, a bit far from center of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it!
reviews.title: WOW! WHAT A JOKE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights post cruise. The service at check-in was awful. It was either very bad training or the girls first day on the job. The process of checking in should not be comparable to a "root canal". The room did provide the great view as advertized but the pretentious "lighting gimmicks" could not mask the many flaws in the room. Oh, by the way, does the W think it is cute to subject weary travelers, just getting to their room to have to waste a half hour figuring out the light switches? The toilet/shower stalls are just ridiculous.What were they thinking? The air conditioner was not working. The shower wand didn't work. The automatic window drapes only worked on one side and would not close all the way after you had to manually pull one side over (allowing the rising sun to splash into the room). Whereas it takes time to temper the shower water to ones liking, it is imposible with just the rainfall shower head without getting the initial "too cold" blast (not nice in the morning). FIVE STARS? We were laughing it was so bad.
reviews.title: Nice but overhyped

reviews.text: They corrected the A/C problem. I didn't complain about the drapes or broken wand because I really didn't want to deal with the staff anymore. The location is very bad. It is laughable to read reviewers speaking of using the metro or busses when their shelling out so much $$$ for a hotel. Of course, when checking out I was presented with a bill for the two nights (we pre-paid), a false mini bar charge and they had my name right but a completely wrong address (root canal part 2).
reviews.title: Fur Coat - No Knickers

reviews.text: But I'll digress. If you don't really care about good service, a poor location, watching your spouse/parter using the toilet, overpriced food, beverage and other amenities, this is just the place for you. Like Whatever/whenever Dude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top notch hotel - nothing comes close. The moment we stepped out of our cab on to the W concrete we were pampered more than we could imagine. I've stayed at the W in Montreal in the past but the service at the W Barcelona is in a class of its own. Staff was bending backwards to help - from the moment they see an unsure look on your face, they are right in front of you asking to help and they never seemed rushed. They were very knowledgeable of the city to the point of writing down addresses of restaurants and stores on our map from the top of their heads. The amenities were exquisite - the Wet pool/bar was amazing and the spa was top shelf. Our room overlooked the harbor - we were able to view cruise ships coming into the Barcelona dock. The room was large and the bed was the most comfortable bed I ever slept in. Barcelona came on the back half of our trip through Spain so by that time we were tired of the traditional Spanish cuisine so the delightful menu at the W came to the rescue. We had 5 out of our 6 meals at the hotel and loved every bite. The location is quite far from the city center - about 20 minutes walking but close to good restaurants in the old port. La Sagrada Familia and other monuments are much farther away - you will need to take a cab. By far this hotel experience ranks as my number 1 of all time.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a summer trip to Barcelona

reviews.text: The most important facts about the W: It is expensive: in everything. Down to the 4 euro 0.5L water or the 7 euro beers (in the room, or the bar).
reviews.title: Gypsys, tramps and thieves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at quite a few W hotels and haven't always thought much of the space and service but we booked there because it's Starwood and we really didn't find a better option. When we got there, we were SO HAPPY we did. After spending 7 days touring all over Barcelona there was no place we would have rather stayed, the location is excellent and the hotel is so stunning that you continuously see people taking pictures of it day and night. Even the locals all seemed to like it as a welcome addition because it isn't an eyesore on their skyline and will surely be an architectural landmark for years to come. Views are all insane, right on the beach at Barceloneta, walking distance to just about everything and cabs are only about 5 to 8 euro if you get tired and want to get a ride back. As for the service, we've been fortunate to stay at many 5 star hotels and I must say that the service here was fantastic, blew away our expectations and overall perceptions of the W. We were there when it was really booked due to Formula One and the service was still excellent across the board. Highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay there whenever we're in Barcelona. And ask for a room facing Barcelona, the rooms all have amazing views but one side faces the cruise ports and the other faces the city.
reviews.title: Best location and amazing service, would only stay there next time.

reviews.text: Located on the Barcelona beach front; this is truly an amazing landmark hotel inside out.
reviews.title: WOW WONDERFUL

reviews.text: Right from check-in it wows you with the smart-casually uniformed friendly staff. Rooms are generously sized and can easily fit in a family of 2 adults and 2 children (under 12). One can actually size up most of Barcelona from the room views.
reviews.title: Wow outstanding in all ways

reviews.text: Major attractions and shopping areas easily accessed by convenient public transport. The beach front has several eateries, bars, cafes and convenience stores.
reviews.title: I assure you this will be rocketing to number 1 place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous food and drinks at the hotel's own restaurant and bar - and if one is thinking even better then the Bravo (restaurant) and Eclipse (Bar) should do the trick. By the way - the pricing is quite competitive considering the quality and portion sizing when measured with outside eateries.
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the W for two nights in June. We had read ahead of time that the W is not centrally located, so we were content to spend two days walking along the beach and exploring the Barcelonetta and Port Vell area. I'm very happy that we did.
reviews.title: Incredible Beach on the Edge of the City

reviews.text: The hotel is a stunning modern building on the very edge of the beach. It looks like a giant silver sail coming out of the ocean. Our room was one of the basic W rooms, but the view was breathtaking, and they set it up in such a way that your floor to ceiling windows are the focal point.
reviews.title: Poolside lunch

reviews.text: While there, we took advantage of the pool deck, the beach, the gym, the W Store and the Eclipse Bar. All of these were done well - the attention to detail and service excellent. The Eclipse Bar was incredibly cool, and the large cocktail list made for a fun cocktail hour near sunset looking out over Barcelona and the ocean. I almost laughed out loud when I used the washroom in the bar to realize that its urinals are set up in such a way as to give you an unobstructed view of the ocean while you are doing your business!
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.text: I think the W chain is known for its level of service. This was confirmed to me in a number of ways - the concierge making us a dinner reservation upon our arrival at a fish restaurant in town; one of the porters getting us a taxi and providing directions to the driver in Catalan so that we wouldn't get lost with the language barrier; pool staff being around and ready to bring us anything we might need in an instant; being able to hop the line to the bar as a paying guest; etc. The service definitely lived up to its reputation.
reviews.title: Amazing place with great views of the sea

reviews.text: Sure, this place is expensive. But I think that's to be expected with the quality of service and the overall experience. I managed to get a good deal on a discount website, making it even better.
reviews.title: Great location, awful service

description: Where Miró meets the Mediterranean, medieval quarters showcase modernista masterpieces and Catalan cuisine complement hot clubs, the W Barcelona is an avant-garde icon rising above a stunning waterfront in Spain’s most dynamic and stylish city.
